name: Numerical Trivia Online Trivia | By The Numbers | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
? and the Mysterians.

	When it was first recorded only 750 copies were made on their manager's Pa-Go-Go label.

questions.text: What movie starred Vincent D'onofrio, Gretchen Mol?
questions.explanation:
The 13th Floor.

	This 1999 Horror/Sci-film was about travelling back in time.

questions.text: How many dimples are said to be on a standard golf ball?
questions.explanation:
336.

	The oldest golf tournament on record was in Prestwick, UK in 1860, later to become the British Open Championship.

questions.text: In the movie "Seven", who played Brad Pitt's wife?
questions.explanation:
Gwyneth Paltrow.

	This 1995 Thriller/Drama also starred Morgan Freeman.

questions.text: How many U.S. Presidents, (including ex-Presidents), have died on July 4th?
questions.explanation:
3.

	Thomas Jefferon and John Adams both died on July 4, 1826.  James Monroe died 5 years later also on July 4th.

The Eagles.

	Originally recorded by Tom Waits, The Eagles did a version of it on their 1974 album "On The Border".

questions.text: Who played Kris Kringle in the 1947 movie "Miracle on 34th Street"?
questions.explanation:
Edmund Gwenn.

	This Christmas classic also starred a very young Maureen O'hara.

questions.text: How many puppies did Pongo and Perdita have in the Disney animated movie "101 Dalmatians"?
questions.explanation:
15.

	The book "The Hundred and One Dalmatians" was written in 1912 by Dodie Smith.  The original Disney movie, which was adapted from the book, came out in 1960.

questions.text: How many people died in the 1979 Three Mile Island nuclear disaster?
questions.explanation:
0.

	On March 28, 1979 Reactor 2 at the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant suffered a partial meltdown. Over 2,000 personal injury claims were filed, but no deaths were recorded.

questions.text: Triskaidekaphobia is the fear of the number 13
questions.explanation:
True.

	In Christian countries the number 13 was considered unlucky because there were 13 persons at the Last Supper of Christ. Fridays are also unlucky, because the Crucifixion was on a Friday. Hence a Friday falling on the thirteenth day is regarded as especially unlucky.
